<script type="text/javascript">
var maindomain_lang = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var main_site_url = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var ajax_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';	
function getParameterByName(name, url) {
		if(url == null){
		  url = window.location.href;
		}
	    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
	    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
		results = regex.exec(url);
	    if (!results) return null;
	    if (!results[2]) return '';
	    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
	}
	var container_q = getParameterByName('container');
	var d_lang = 'en';	
</script>

<meta property="og:author" content="Andy Piazza"/>
<meta property="og:authorlink" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/author/"/>
<meta property="og:author_image_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/unit-news-meta.svg"/>
<meta name="post_tags" content="Cisco,CVE-2025-20333,CVE-2025-20362,CVE-2025-20363,zero-day"/>
<script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"BlogPosting","headline":"Threat Insights: Active Exploitation of Cisco ASA Zero Days","name":"Threat Insights: Active Exploitation of Cisco ASA Zero Days","description":"CVE-2025-20333, CVE-2025-20362 and CVE-2025-20363 affect multiple Cisco products, and are being exploited by a threat actor linked to the ArcaneDoor campaign. ","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/zero-day-vulnerabilities-affect-cisco-software\/","mainEntityOfPage":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/zero-day-vulnerabilities-affect-cisco-software\/","datePublished":"September 26, 2025","articleBody":"September 2025 Zero-Day Vulnerabilities Affecting Cisco Software\r\nCisco has reported that a sophisticated state-sponsored threat actor is actively exploiting multiple zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) and Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) software. Cisco identifies this as the same threat actor from a previous campaign they named ArcaneDoor.\r\n\r\nThis threat actor primarily targets government networks worldwide for data exfiltration. Cisco observed attackers exploiting these newly identified zero-day vulnerabilities while employing advanced evasion techniques to prevent logging and identification of this activity.\r\n\r\nThe trend of suspected nation-state adversaries exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities in internet-facing devices continues. Also known as edge devices, these internet-facing appliances act as the security perimeter between an organization's internal network and the public internet. This includes firewalls, VPN gateways, routers and load balancers. Compromising these devices provides a direct and often stealthy entry point into a network.\r\nDetails of the Vulnerabilities\r\nCisco published advisories for three critical vulnerabilities in ASA and FTD. Two of these, CVE-2025-20333 and CVE-2025-20362, are currently under active exploitation by adversaries in the wild. Cisco identified a third vulnerability, CVE-2025-20363, as being at high risk for imminent exploitation. These vulnerabilities allow attackers to execute arbitrary code, exfiltrate data and implant persistent malware to maintain access even after a device is rebooted.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nCVE Number\r\nDescription\r\nCVSS Severity\r\n\r\n\r\nCVE-2025-20333\r\nA vulnerability in the VPN web server of Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected device.\u00a0\r\n9.9 Critical\r\n\r\n\r\nCVE-2025-20362\r\nA vulnerability in the VPN web server of Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to access restricted URL endpoints that are related to remote access VPN that should otherwise be inaccessible without authentication.\u00a0\r\n6.7 Medium\r\n\r\n\r\nCVE-2025-20363\r\nA vulnerability in the web services of Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software, Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software, Cisco IOS Software, Cisco IOS XE Software and Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker (Cisco ASA and FTD Software) or authenticated, remote attacker (Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR Software) with low user privileges to execute arbitrary code on an affected device.\u00a0\r\n9.0 Critical\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nAs of Sep. 25, 2025, Cisco has released software updates to address all three vulnerabilities. It urges organizations to prioritize the immediate upgrade of all affected systems to the latest available software versions to mitigate the threat and prevent compromise.\r\n\r\nThe U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) issued Emergency Directive (ED) 25-03, mandating immediate mitigation for federal agencies due to the significant risk posed by this campaign. The vulnerabilities affect critical perimeter network devices, posing a substantial risk to both public and private sector organizations.\r\n\r\nThe U.K.\u2019s National Cyber Security Center (NCSC) published a malware analysis report [PDF] on the RayInitiator and LINE VIPER malware families used in attacks to exploit these zero-day vulnerabilities. According to their analysis, RayInitiator is a multi-stage Grand Unified Bootloader (GRUB) bootkit that services reboots and firmware upgrades. It also deploys the LINE VIPER shellcode loader to Cisco ASA 5500-X series devices that do not have secure boot. LINE VIPER is loaded into memory by RayInitiator and it receives command and control instructions over WebVPN client authentication sessions over HTTPS or via ICMP with responses over raw TCP.\r\nLifecycle of Zero-Day Vulnerabilities\r\nAdversaries, particularly nation-state actors, are dedicating significant resources to discovering and exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities in edge devices. Since these flaws are previously unknown, they provide attackers a critical window of opportunity before a vendor can release a patch. Once a zero-day is weaponized, attackers can use the exploit against a wide range of organizations using the same vulnerable product.\r\n\r\nAdditionally, after a nation-state actor successfully uses a zero-day exploit, the knowledge of that vulnerability and the methods for exploitation inevitably become less exclusive over time. This leads to a secondary, and often more widespread, phase of exploitation.\r\n\r\nOther threat actors may reverse-engineer the original sophisticated exploit, or a public advisory and patch release from a vendor might reveal the underlying vulnerability. This disclosure acts as a blueprint for cybercriminal groups and opportunistic hackers.\r\n\r\nThese adversaries then develop their own proof-of-concept (PoC) code, which is often simpler and less stealthy than the nation-state's original exploit, but still highly effective against unpatched systems. This PoC code is rapidly weaponized and sold on dark web forums or integrated into exploit kits, making the once-exclusive capability of a nation-state accessible to a much broader range of financially motivated attackers.\r\n\r\nThis phenomenon creates a \u201cpatch-or-perish\u201d scenario, where organizations that fail to apply vendor patches promptly are left highly vulnerable to a new wave of mass-scale, opportunistic attacks.\r\nConclusion\r\nPalo Alto Networks recommends patching immediately. Cisco also provides temporary mitigation guidance for devices that are vulnerable but unable to be updated. Those temporary mitigations include their own risks, such as disabling SSL\/TLS-based VPN web services.\r\n\r\nPalo Alto Networks recommends reviewing the following advisories for further information about the campaign and detecting this activity.\r\n\r\n \tSecurity Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software and Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software VPN Web Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability\r\n \tSecurity Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software and Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software VPN Web Server Unauthorized Access Vulnerability\r\n \tSecurity Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software, Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software, IOS Software, IOS XE Software, and IOS XR Software Web Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability\r\n\r\nThe Appendix to this article provides two hunting queries for our Cortex XDR and XSIAM customers to identify when logging is disabled or disrupted from Cisco ASA devices.\r\n\r\nIf you think you might have been compromised or have an urgent matter, get in touch with the Unit 42 Incident Response team or call:\r\n\r\n \tNorth America: Toll Free: +1 (866) 486-4842 (866.4.UNIT42)\r\n \tUK: +44.20.3743.3660\r\n \tEurope and Middle East: +31.20.299.3130\r\n \tAsia: +65.6983.8730\r\n \tJapan: +81.50.1790.0200\r\n \tAustralia: +61.2.4062.7950\r\n \tIndia: 000 800 050 45107\r\n\r\nAdditional Resources\r\n\r\n \tSecurity Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software and Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software VPN Web Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability - Cisco\r\n \tSecurity Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software and Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software VPN Web Server Unauthorized Access Vulnerability - Cisco\r\n \tSecurity Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software, Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software, IOS Software, IOS XE Software, and IOS XR Software Web Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability - Cisco\r\n \tCisco Event Response: Continued Attacks Against Cisco Firewalls - Cisco\r\n \tDetection Guide for Continued Attacks against Cisco Firewalls by the Threat Actor behind ArcaneDoor - Cisco\r\n \tMalware Analysis Report: RayInitiator &amp; LINE VIPER [PDF] - National Cyber Security Center, UK\r\n\r\nAppendix\r\nUnit 42 developed the following two hunting queries for our Cortex XDR customers to identify when logging is disabled or disrupted from Cisco ASA devices.\r\n\r\nThis query graphs all log types from Cisco ASA devices:\r\ndataset = cisco_asa_raw\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level = arrayindex(regextract(_raw_log, \"\\s%.*?(ASA\\-[\\d])\\-[\\d]{1,}\\:\"), 0)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = \"\"\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-1\"), \"Alert Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-2\"), \"Critical Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-3\"), \"Error Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-4\"), \"Warning Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-5\"), \"Notification Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-6\"), \"Informational Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-7\"), \"Debug Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter debug_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-7\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter info_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-6\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter notification_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-5\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter warning_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-4\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter error_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-3\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter critical_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-2\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-1\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter Date = format_timestamp(\"%Y\/%m\/%d\", _time)\r\n\r\n\/\/ Check for all messages\r\n\r\n| comp sum(info_count) as info_log_count, sum(debug_count) as debug_log_count, sum(notification_count) as notification_log_count, sum(warning_count) as warning_log_count, sum(error_count) as error_log_count, sum(critical_count) as critical_log_count, sum(alert_count) as alert_log_count by Date\r\n\r\n| sort asc Date\r\n\r\n| view graph type = line xaxis = Date yaxis = info_log_count, debug_log_count, notification_log_count, warning_count, error_log_count,critical_log_count,alert_log_count header = \"All Logs\"\r\nThis query graphs debug and info logging from Cisco ASA devices (Note: debug and info logs require manual configuration):\r\ndataset = cisco_asa_raw\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level = arrayindex(regextract(_raw_log, \"\\s%.*?(ASA\\-[\\d])\\-[\\d]{1,}\\:\"), 0)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = \"\"\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-1\"), \"Alert Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-2\"), \"Critical Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-3\"), \"Error Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-4\"), \"Warning Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-5\"), \"Notification Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-6\"), \"Informational Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains \"ASA-7\"), \"Debug Message\", alert_level_friendly)\r\n\r\n| alter debug_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-7\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter info_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-6\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter notification_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-5\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter warning_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-4\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter error_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-3\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter critical_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-2\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter alert_count = if(alert_level = \"ASA-1\", 1, 0)\r\n\r\n| alter Date = format_timestamp(\"%Y\/%m\/%d\", _time)\r\n\r\n\/\/ Focus only on the Informational and Debug messages\r\n\r\n| filter alert_level_friendly in (\"Informational Message\", \"Debug Message\")\r\n\r\n| comp sum(info_count) as info_log_count, sum(debug_count) as debug_log_count by Date\r\n\r\n| sort asc Date\r\n\r\n| view graph type = line xaxis = Date yaxis = info_log_count, debug_log_count header = \"Info + Debug Logs\"","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","@id":"#panworg"},"image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2025\/09\/05_Myth-Busting_Overview_1920x900-300x300.jpg","width":300,"height":300},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","xPath":["\/html\/head\/title","\/html\/head\/meta[@name='description']\/@content"]},"author":[{"@type":"Person","name":"Andy Piazza"}]}</script><link rel='stylesheet' id='crayon-css' href='https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/plugins/crayon-syntax-highlighter/css/min/crayon.min.css?ver=_2.7.2_beta' media='all' />

40%,rgb(238,44,130) 60%,rgb(251,105,98) 80%,rgb(254,248,76) 100%);--wp--preset--gradient--blush-light-purple: linear-gradient(135deg,rgb(255,206,236) 0%,rgb(152,150,240) linear-gradient(135deg,rgb(255,203,112) 0%,rgb(199,81,192) 50%,rgb(65,88,208) 100%);--wp--preset--gradient--pale-ocean: linear-gradient(135deg,rgb(255,245,203) 0%,rgb(182,227,212) 50%,rgb(51,167,181) 100%);--wp--preset--gradient--electric-grass: linear-gradient(135deg,rgb(202,248,128) 0%,rgb(113,206,126) 100%);--wp--preset--gradient--midnight: linear-gradient(135deg,rgb(2,3,129) 0%,rgb(40,116,252) 3.38rem;--wp--preset--spacing--80: 5.06rem;--wp--preset--shadow--natural: 6px 6px 9px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);--wp--preset--shadow--deep: 12px 12px 50px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);--wp--preset--shadow--sharp: 6px     <script type="text/javascript">
    ;(function(win, doc, style, timeout) {
    var STYLE_ID = 'at-body-style';
    function getParent() {
    return doc.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
    }
    function addStyle(parent, id, def) {
        if (!parent) {
        return;
        }
        var style = doc.createElement('style');
        style.id = id;
        style.innerHTML = def;
        parent.appendChild(style);
    }
    function removeStyle(parent, id) {
        if (!parent) {
            return;
        }
        var style = doc.getElementById(id);
        if (!style) {
            return;
        }
        parent.removeChild(style);
    }
    addStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID, style);
    setTimeout(function() {
    removeStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID);
    }, timeout);
    }(window, document, "body {visibility:hidden !important}", 3000));
    </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
var isIE11 = !!navigator.userAgent.match(/Trident.*rv\:11\./);
if(isIE11){
    var polyfill = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/scripts/polyfill.min.js';
    document.write('<script type="text/javascript" src="'+polyfill+'">\x3C/script>');
}
    /**
 * String.prototype.replaceAll() polyfill
 * https://gomakethings.com/how-to-replace-a-section-of-a-string-with-another-one-with-vanilla-js/
 * @author Chris Ferdinandi
 * @license MIT
 */
if (!String.prototype.replaceAll) {
	String.prototype.replaceAll = function(str, newStr){
		// If a regex pattern
		if (Object.prototype.toString.call(str).toLowerCase() === '[object regexp]') {
			return this.replace(str, newStr);
		}
		// If a string
		return this.replace(new RegExp(str, 'g'), newStr);
	};
}

    /*! lozad.js - v1.16.0 - 2020-09-06 */

/**
   * Detect IE browser
   * @const {boolean}
   * @private
   */var g="undefined"!=typeof document&&document.documentMode,f={rootMargin:"0px",threshold:0,load:function(t){if("picture"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()){var e=t.querySelector("img"),r=!1;null===e&&(e=document.createElement("img"),r=!0),g&&t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")&&(e.src=t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")),t.getAttribute("data-alt")&&(e.alt=t.getAttribute("data-alt")),r&&t.append(e)}if("video"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()&&!t.getAttribute("data-src")&&t.children){for(var a=t.children,o=void 0,i=0;i<=a.length-1;i++)(o=a[i].getAttribute("data-src"))&&(a[i].src=o);t.load()}t.getAttribute("data-poster")&&(t.poster=t.getAttribute("data-poster")),t.getAttribute("data-src")&&(t.src=t.getAttribute("data-src")),t.getAttribute("data-srcset")&&t.setAttribute("srcset",t.getAttribute("data-srcset"));var n=",";if(t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")&&(n=t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")),t.getAttribute("data-background-image"))t.style.backgroundImage="url('"+t.getAttribute("data-background-image").split(n).join("'),url('")+"')";else if(t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set")){var d=t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set").split(n),u=d[0].substr(0,d[0].indexOf(" "))||d[0];// Substring before ... 1x

</script>

</ul>  </div>
</nav>
<div class="panClean pan-template-home" id="main-nav-menu-cont" style="display:none;">
    <div class="cleanHeader mainNavigationComp baseComponent parbase">
        <div class="productNav2021Component dark default" id="PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC">
        </div>
  </div>
<div class="cleanTopHtml htmlComp baseComponent parbase"><div class="base-component-spacer spacer-none  "></div>
</div>
</div>
<!--  Start: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->
<script type="text/javascript">
	function getCookie(cname) {
	 	var name = cname + "=";
  		var decodedCookie = decodeURIComponent(document.cookie);
		var ca = decodedCookie.split(';');
  		for(var i = 0; i <ca.length; i++) {
    			var c = ca[i];
    			while (c.charAt(0) == ' ') {
     				 c = c.substring(1);
    			}
    			if (c.indexOf(name) == 0) {
    				 return c.substring(name.length, c.length);
    			}
  		}
  		return "";
	}

	var referer = "";//sessionStorage.container;
	var pcontainer = sessionStorage.getItem("container");
	var searchResultsPagePath = "";
	if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Prisma')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Prisma' ;
	}        
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Cortex')!=-1)){
            if( pcontainer.indexOf('CloudCortex') != -1){
                referer = 'CloudCortex' ;
            }
            else{
                referer = 'Cortex' ;
            }	    
	}
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Sase')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Sase' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Unit')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Unit' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Ngfw')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Ngfw' ;
	}
        var fromRef = document.referrer;
        var nContainer = getCookie("navContainer");
        if(nContainer){//If user is coming from main site, we need to reset the container		
		if(fromRef  && fromRef.indexOf("prismacloud.io")!=-1){
                        referer = 'Prisma' ;
                        sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                } else if(fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.com")!=-1 || fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.jp")!=-1 ){
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Prisma') != -1){
                            referer = 'Prisma' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                        }
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Cortex') != -1){
                            if( nContainer.indexOf('CloudCortex') != -1){
                                referer = 'CloudCortex';
                                sessionStorage.setItem("container","CloudCortex");
                            }
                            else{
                                referer = 'Cortex';
                                sessionStorage.setItem("container","Cortex");
                            }                            
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Sase') != -1){
                            referer = 'Sase' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Sase");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Unit') != -1){
                            referer = 'Unit' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Ngfw') != -1){
                            referer = 'Ngfw' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Ngfw");
                        }
			document.cookie = 'navContainer=; path=/; domain=.paloaltonetworks.com; expires=' + new Date(0).toUTCString();
		}
	}
if(referer != "Prisma" && referer != "CloudCortex" && referer != "Cortex" && referer != "Sase" && referer != "Unit" && referer != "Ngfw") {
    referer = 'Unit' ;
    sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
}
function callMainSitePrismaNavHTML(){
    
    var referrer_domain = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
    sessionStorage.setItem("domain",referrer_domain);
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderPrisma.prismaRenderer.html';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=prisma&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/prismasearch";
        }
    if(referer == 'CloudCortex'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=cortexcloud&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexcloudsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderCortex.cortexRenderer.html';	
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=cortex&domain=en';	
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Sase'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderSase.saseRenderer.html';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=sase&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/sasesearch";
    }
    if(referer == 'Unit'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=unit42&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/content/pan/en_US/search/unit42search";
		    }
    if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        //var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/ngfw-cdss-nav-renderer.php';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=ngfw&domain=en'; 
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/ngfwcdsssearch";
    }
    httpGet(menu_url,'menu_html');
    document.getElementById('main-nav-menu-cont').removeAttribute("style");
}
function addStyle(styles) {            
    /* Create style document */
    var css = document.createElement('style');
    css.type = 'text/css';

    if (css.styleSheet) 
        css.styleSheet.cssText = styles;
    else 
        css.appendChild(document.createTextNode(styles));

    /* Append style to the tag name */
    document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(css);
}
function httpGet(theUrl,req_type) {
    if (window.XMLHttpRequest) { // code for IE7+, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Safari
        xmlhttp=new XMLHttpRequest();
    } else {// code for IE6, IE5
        xmlhttp=new ActiveXObject("Microsoft.XMLHTTP");
    }
    xmlhttp.onreadystatechange=function()
    {
        if (xmlhttp.readyState==4 && xmlhttp.status==200)
        {
            if(req_type == 'menu_html'){
            var nav_text = xmlhttp.responseText.replaceAll('https://static.cloud.coveo.com/searchui/v2.9159/js/CoveoJsSearch.Lazy.min.js', '');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll('src="/', 'src="'+maindomain_lang+'/');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll("'/content", "'"+maindomain_lang+"/content");
                        
            document.getElementById("PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC").innerHTML = nav_text.replaceAll('href="/', 'href="'+maindomain_lang+'/');

            var lozad_back = document.getElementsByClassName('lozad-background');
            Array.prototype.forEach.call(lozad_back, function(el) {
            // Do stuff here
            var el_back_img_path = el.getAttribute('data-background-image');
            var first_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'");
            var last_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'",first_pos+1);
            el_back_img_path = el_back_img_path.substring(first_pos+1,last_pos);
            el.setAttribute("data-background-image",main_site_url+el_back_img_path);
            });
            const observer_lozad = lozad('.lozad, .lozad-background'); // lazy loads elements with default selector as '.lozad'
            observer_lozad.observe();
            }
            if(req_type == 'head_inline_css'){
            addStyle(xmlhttp.responseText);
            }
        }
    }
    xmlhttp.open("GET", theUrl, true );
    xmlhttp.send();    
}    
    
if(referer == 'Prisma' || referer == 'CloudCortex' || referer == 'Cortex' || referer == 'Sase' || referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
    const article = document.querySelector('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC');
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        article.dataset.type = 'prisma';
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    else if(referer == 'CloudCortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cloudcortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Sase'){
        article.dataset.type = 'sase';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Unit'){
        article.dataset.type = 'unit';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        article.dataset.type = 'ngfw';
    }
    //set class to default
    if(referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    callMainSitePrismaNavHTML();
}
</script>
<!--  End: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->



<main class="main">

				</li>
	  </ul>
    </div>                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </section> 
    <section class="section blog-contents"> 
      <div class="pa blog-editor">
        <div class="l-container">
          <div class="be__wrapper">
            <div class="be__contents">
              <div class="be__contents-wrapper">
                <h2><a id="post-159141-_wven14kmgum2"></a>September 2025 Zero-Day Vulnerabilities Affecting Cisco Software</h2>
<p><a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/resources/asa_ftd_continued_attacks" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Cisco has reported</a> that a sophisticated state-sponsored threat actor is actively exploiting multiple zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) and Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) software. Cisco identifies this as the same threat actor from a previous campaign they named ArcaneDoor.</p>
<p>This threat actor primarily targets government networks worldwide for data exfiltration. Cisco observed attackers exploiting these newly identified zero-day vulnerabilities while employing advanced evasion techniques to prevent logging and identification of this activity.</p>
<p>The trend of suspected nation-state adversaries exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities in internet-facing devices continues. Also known as edge devices, these internet-facing appliances act as the security perimeter between an organization's internal network and the public internet. This includes firewalls, VPN gateways, routers and load balancers. Compromising these devices provides a direct and often stealthy entry point into a network.</p>
<h2><a id="post-159141-_kkr0b9qy8qa5"></a>Details of the Vulnerabilities</h2>
<p>Cisco published advisories for three critical vulnerabilities in ASA and FTD. Two of these, <a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-asaftd-webvpn-z5xP8EUB" target="_blank" rel="noopener">CVE-2025-20333</a> and <a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-asaftd-webvpn-YROOTUW" target="_blank" rel="noopener">CVE-2025-20362</a>, are currently under active exploitation by adversaries in the wild. Cisco identified a third vulnerability, <a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-http-code-exec-WmfP3h3O" target="_blank" rel="noopener">CVE-2025-20363</a>, as being at high risk for imminent exploitation. These vulnerabilities allow attackers to execute arbitrary code, exfiltrate data and implant persistent malware to maintain access even after a device is rebooted.</p>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20.1859%; text-align: center;"><b>CVE Number</b></td>
<td style="text-align: center; width: 61.233%;"><b>Description</b></td>
<td style="width: 17.7365%; text-align: center;"><b>CVSS Severity</b></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20.1859%; text-align: center;"><a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-asaftd-webvpn-z5xP8EUB"><span style="font-weight: 400;">CVE-2025-20333</span></a></td>
<td style="width: 61.233%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">A vulnerability in the VPN web server of Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected device. </span></td>
<td style="width: 17.7365%; text-align: center;"><b>9.9 Critical</b></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20.1859%; text-align: center;"><a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-asaftd-webvpn-YROOTUW"><span style="font-weight: 400;">CVE-2025-20362</span></a></td>
<td style="width: 61.233%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">A vulnerability in the VPN web server of Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to access restricted URL endpoints that are related to remote access VPN that should otherwise be inaccessible without authentication. </span></td>
<td style="width: 17.7365%; text-align: center;"><b>6.7 Medium</b></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20.1859%; text-align: center;"><a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-http-code-exec-WmfP3h3O"><span style="font-weight: 400;">CVE-2025-20363</span></a></td>
<td style="width: 61.233%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">A vulnerability in the web services of Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software, Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software, Cisco IOS Software, Cisco IOS XE Software and Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker (Cisco ASA and FTD Software) or authenticated, remote attacker (Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR Software) with low user privileges to execute arbitrary code on an affected device. </span></td>
<td style="width: 17.7365%; text-align: center;"><b>9.0 Critical</b></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>As of Sep. 25, 2025, Cisco has released software updates to address all three vulnerabilities. It urges organizations to prioritize the immediate upgrade of all affected systems to the latest available software versions to mitigate the threat and prevent compromise.</p>
<p>The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) issued <a href="https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-25-03-identify-and-mitigate-potential-compromise-cisco-devices" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Emergency Directive (ED) 25-03</a>, mandating immediate mitigation for federal agencies due to the significant risk posed by this campaign. The vulnerabilities affect critical perimeter network devices, posing a substantial risk to both public and private sector organizations.</p>
<p>The U.K.’s National Cyber Security Center (NCSC) published a <a href="https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/static-assets/documents/malware-analysis-reports/RayInitiator-LINE-VIPER/ncsc-mar-rayinitiator-line-viper.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">malware analysis report [PDF]</a> on the RayInitiator and LINE VIPER malware families used in attacks to exploit these zero-day vulnerabilities. According to their analysis, RayInitiator is a multi-stage Grand Unified Bootloader (GRUB) bootkit that services reboots and firmware upgrades. It also deploys the LINE VIPER shellcode loader to Cisco ASA 5500-X series devices that do not have secure boot. LINE VIPER is loaded into memory by RayInitiator and it receives command and control instructions over WebVPN client authentication sessions over HTTPS or via ICMP with responses over raw TCP.</p>
<h2><a id="post-159141-_93py7bsao8kw"></a>Lifecycle of Zero-Day Vulnerabilities</h2>
<p>Adversaries, particularly nation-state actors, are dedicating significant resources to discovering and exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities in edge devices. Since these flaws are previously unknown, they provide attackers a critical window of opportunity before a vendor can release a patch. Once a zero-day is weaponized, attackers can use the exploit against a wide range of organizations using the same vulnerable product.</p>
<p>Additionally, after a nation-state actor successfully uses a zero-day exploit, the knowledge of that vulnerability and the methods for exploitation inevitably become less exclusive over time. This leads to a secondary, and often more widespread, phase of exploitation.</p>
<p>Other threat actors may reverse-engineer the original sophisticated exploit, or a public advisory and patch release from a vendor might reveal the underlying vulnerability. This disclosure acts as a blueprint for cybercriminal groups and opportunistic hackers.</p>
<p>These adversaries then develop their own proof-of-concept (PoC) code, which is often simpler and less stealthy than the nation-state's original exploit, but still highly effective against unpatched systems. This PoC code is rapidly weaponized and sold on dark web forums or integrated into exploit kits, making the once-exclusive capability of a nation-state accessible to a much broader range of financially motivated attackers.</p>
<p>This phenomenon creates a “patch-or-perish” scenario, where organizations that fail to apply vendor patches promptly are left highly vulnerable to a new wave of mass-scale, opportunistic attacks.</p>
<h2><a id="post-159141-_40zwcep7agmf"></a>Conclusion</h2>
<p>Palo Alto Networks recommends patching immediately. Cisco also provides <a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/resources/asa_ftd_continued_attacks#:~:text=Option%202%3A%20Mitigate%20(temporary%20solution%20only)" target="_blank" rel="noopener">temporary mitigation guidance</a> for devices that are vulnerable but unable to be updated. Those temporary mitigations include their own risks, such as disabling SSL/TLS-based VPN web services.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks recommends reviewing the following advisories for further information about the campaign and detecting this activity.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-asaftd-webvpn-z5xP8EUB" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Security Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software and Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software VPN Web Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability</a></li>
<li><a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-asaftd-webvpn-YROOTUW" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Security Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software and Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software VPN Web Server Unauthorized Access Vulnerability</a></li>
<li><a href="https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-http-code-exec-WmfP3h3O" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Security Advisory: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance Software, Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software, IOS Software, IOS XE Software, and IOS XR Software Web Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability</a></li>
</ul>
<p>The <a href="#post-159141-_82r956t6ygn5">Appendix</a> to this article provides two hunting queries for our Cortex XDR and XSIAM customers to identify when logging is disabled or disrupted from Cisco ASA devices.</p>
<p>If you think you might have been compromised or have an urgent matter, get in touch with the <a href="https://start.paloaltonetworks.com/contact-unit42.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Unit 42 Incident Response team</a> or call:</p>
<ul>
<li>North America: Toll Free: +1 (866) 486-4842 (866.4.UNIT42)</li>

<li>Europe and Middle East: +31.20.299.3130</li>
<li>Asia: +65.6983.8730</li>

<h2><a id="post-159141-_82r956t6ygn5"></a>Appendix</h2>
<p>Unit 42 developed the following two hunting queries for our Cortex XDR customers to identify when logging is disabled or disrupted from Cisco ASA devices.</p>
<p>This query graphs all log types from Cisco ASA devices:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
dataset = cisco_asa_raw

| alter alert_level = arrayindex(regextract(_raw_log, "\s%.*?(ASA\-[\d])\-[\d]{1,}\:"), 0)

| alter alert_level_friendly = ""

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-1"), "Alert Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-2"), "Critical Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-3"), "Error Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-4"), "Warning Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-5"), "Notification Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-6"), "Informational Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-7"), "Debug Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter debug_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-7", 1, 0)

| alter info_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-6", 1, 0)

| alter notification_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-5", 1, 0)

| alter warning_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-4", 1, 0)

| alter error_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-3", 1, 0)

| alter critical_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-2", 1, 0)

| alter alert_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-1", 1, 0)

| alter Date = format_timestamp("%Y/%m/%d", _time)

// Check for all messages

| comp sum(info_count) as info_log_count, sum(debug_count) as debug_log_count, sum(notification_count) as notification_log_count, sum(warning_count) as warning_log_count, sum(error_count) as error_log_count, sum(critical_count) as critical_log_count, sum(alert_count) as alert_log_count by Date

| sort asc Date

| view graph type = line xaxis = Date yaxis = info_log_count, debug_log_count, notification_log_count, warning_count, error_log_count,critical_log_count,alert_log_count header = "All Logs"</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-1">1</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-2">2</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-3">3</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-4">4</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-5">5</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-6">6</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-7">7</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-8">8</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-9">9</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-10">10</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-11">11</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-12">12</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-13">13</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-14">14</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-15">15</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-16">16</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-17">17</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-18">18</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-19">19</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-20">20</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-21">21</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-22">22</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-23">23</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-24">24</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-25">25</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-26">26</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-27">27</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-28">28</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-29">29</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-30">30</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-31">31</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-32">32</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-33">33</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-34">34</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-35">35</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-36">36</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-37">37</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-38">38</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-39">39</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-40">40</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-41">41</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-42">42</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-43">43</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-1"><span class="crayon-i">dataset</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">cisco_asa_raw</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-2">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-3"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">arrayindex</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">regextract</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">_raw_log</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"\s%.*?(ASA\-[\d])\-[\d]{1,}\:"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-4">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-5"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">""</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-6">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-7"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">alert_level </span><span class="crayon-i">contains</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-1"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"Alert Message"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-8">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-9"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">alert_level </span><span class="crayon-i">contains</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-2"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"Critical Message"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-10">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-11"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">alert_level </span><span class="crayon-i">contains</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-3"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"Error Message"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-12">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-13"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">alert_level </span><span class="crayon-i">contains</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-4"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"Warning Message"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-14">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-15"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">alert_level </span><span class="crayon-i">contains</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-5"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"Notification Message"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-16">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-17"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">alert_level </span><span class="crayon-i">contains</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-6"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"Informational Message"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-18">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-19"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">alert_level </span><span class="crayon-i">contains</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-7"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"Debug Message"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level_friendly</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-20">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-21"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">debug_count</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-7"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-22">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-23"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">info_count</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-6"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-24">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-25"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">notification_count</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-5"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-26">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-27"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">warning_count</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-4"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-28">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-29"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">error_count</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-3"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-30">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-31"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">critical_count</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-2"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-32">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-33"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">alert_count</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">alert_level</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"ASA-1"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-34">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-35"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alter </span><span class="crayon-i">Date</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">format_timestamp</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-s">"%Y/%m/%d"</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">_time</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-36">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-37"><span class="crayon-c">// Check for all messages</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-38">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-39"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">comp </span><span class="crayon-e">sum</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">info_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">as</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">info_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">sum</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">debug_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">as</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">debug_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">sum</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">notification_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">as</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">notification_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">sum</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">warning_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">as</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">warning_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">sum</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">error_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">as</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">error_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">sum</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">critical_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">as</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">critical_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">sum</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">alert_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">as</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">alert_log_count </span><span class="crayon-e">by </span><span class="crayon-i">Date</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-40">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-41"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">sort </span><span class="crayon-e">asc </span><span class="crayon-i">Date</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-42">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-68d87b5ed930e513978947-43"><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">view </span><span class="crayon-e">graph </span><span class="crayon-i">type</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">line </span><span class="crayon-i">xaxis</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">Date </span><span class="crayon-i">yaxis</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">info_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">debug_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">notification_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">warning_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">error_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-i">critical_log_count</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-e">alert_log_count </span><span class="crayon-i">header</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"All Logs"</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0009 seconds] -->
<p>This query graphs debug and info logging from Cisco ASA devices (Note: debug and info logs require manual configuration):</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
dataset = cisco_asa_raw

| alter alert_level = arrayindex(regextract(_raw_log, "\s%.*?(ASA\-[\d])\-[\d]{1,}\:"), 0)

| alter alert_level_friendly = ""

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-1"), "Alert Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-2"), "Critical Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-3"), "Error Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-4"), "Warning Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-5"), "Notification Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-6"), "Informational Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter alert_level_friendly = if((alert_level contains "ASA-7"), "Debug Message", alert_level_friendly)

| alter debug_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-7", 1, 0)

| alter info_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-6", 1, 0)

| alter notification_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-5", 1, 0)

| alter warning_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-4", 1, 0)

| alter error_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-3", 1, 0)

| alter critical_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-2", 1, 0)

| alter alert_count = if(alert_level = "ASA-1", 1, 0)

| alter Date = format_timestamp("%Y/%m/%d", _time)

// Focus only on the Informational and Debug messages

| filter alert_level_friendly in ("Informational Message", "Debug Message")

| comp sum(info_count) as info_log_count, sum(debug_count) as debug_log_count by Date

| sort asc Date

| view graph type = line xaxis = Date yaxis = info_log_count, debug_log_count header = "Info + Debug Logs"</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-1">1</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-2">2</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-3">3</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-4">4</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-5">5</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-6">6</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-7">7</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-8">8</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-9">9</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-10">10</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-11">11</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-12">12</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-13">13</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-14">14</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-15">15</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-16">16</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-17">17</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-18">18</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-19">19</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-20">20</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-21">21</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-22">22</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-23">23</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-24">24</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-25">25</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-30">30</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-31">31</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-38">38</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-68d87b5ed931d302921038-39">39</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" 				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div 					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0009 seconds] -->
<p></p>
      
              </div>
              <!--<span class="post__date">Updated 26 September, 2025 at 12:54 PM PDT</span>-->
              <button class="l-btn back-to-top" id="backToTop" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="zero-day-vulnerabilities-affect-cisco-software:back to top">Back to top</button>

				<h3>Tags</h3><ul role="list"><li role="listitem"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/cisco/" role="link" title="Cisco" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="zero-day-vulnerabilities-affect-cisco-software:tags:Cisco">Cisco</a></li><li role="listitem"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/cve-2025-20333/" role="link" title="CVE-2025-20333" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="zero-day-vulnerabilities-affect-cisco-software:tags:CVE-2025-20333">CVE-2025-20333</a></li><li role="listitem"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/cve-2025-20362/" role="link" title="CVE-2025-20362" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="zero-day-vulnerabilities-affect-cisco-software:tags:CVE-2025-20362">CVE-2025-20362</a></li><li role="listitem"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/cve-2025-20363/" role="link" title="CVE-2025-20363" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="zero-day-vulnerabilities-affect-cisco-software:tags:CVE-2025-20363">CVE-2025-20363</a></li><li role="listitem"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/zero-day/" role="link" title="zero-day" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="zero-day-vulnerabilities-affect-cisco-software:tags:zero-day">Zero-day</a></li></ul>
